children.text: Wait, but wait, what about the case where even indices are all same, and odd indices are all same, but their parities are different. Then, can we choose x and y to make them same? Yes. For example, even indices are all 1 (odd), odd indices are all 0 (even). Then, choose x=0, y=1. Then even indices remain 1, odd become 1. So all odd. So yes. Another example: even indices are 0 (even), odd indices are 1 (odd). Choose x=1, y=0. Then even indices become 1, odd stay 1. So all odd. So yes. So the condition is correct.
children.label: mental_execution
